Articles.Content:
Hello all,

Name's Geo, or Geoff- I respond to either. I've been a KSP mass murd- planetary explorer for a little over half a year now and it's finally time I dip my toe into the forum. Very briefly, I run my program on the Jeb Kermin style of rocketry, (Who needs equations to have a little fun?) and my KSP claim to fame is that I have successfully touched down and performed an EVA on Minmus, but not yet the Mun. Jedfel Kermin is still, ah- performing long term vital experiments on the surface of Minmus as I type.

That said, I'm starting to shift more towards a realistic style of play, with the eventual goal of retrieving Jedfel. So we'll see how that goes. Around these parts, you can expect to find me in the fan-works section. I'm something of a writer, and the other day as I was explod-testing new lander stages I started thinking about the mission control fellows for the first time, and how they must change as a player goes from, 'Whee explosions!' to 'Crunching numbers and doing rocket science'. So keep an eye out in the next week or so for the start of a story-esque piece as my KSC management is 'let to to explore other opportunities' and the new guy is brought in to change things around.

Look forward to meeting you all.

Hi GeotheArch, welcome to the community

I'm looking forwards to reading your stuff, plus good luck on rescuing Jedfel, you can send a 3 Kerbal pod with 1 empty seat, or you could try the crewtank.
